intro: Coreocarpus, commonly known as the sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Australia and New Zealand. These plants are characterized by their small, clustered flowers and hairy, often succulent leaves. The fruits are typically small, dry, and indehiscent, containing a single seed. Coreocarpus species are often found in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
